summary: This is a court order from the Southern District of Florida granting a motion to produce the non-prosecution agreement between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Jeffrey Epstein. The order establishes strict protective procedures for the disclosure of the agreement to the petitioners (Jane Does 1 and 2) and other identified victims, prohibiting them from sharing its terms with third parties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; the non-prosecution agreement between him and the U.S. Attorney's Office is the subject of the court order.

persons.name: Kenneth A. Marra
persons.context: The judge who issued the order granting the motion to produce the non-prosecution agreement and established the protective procedures.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: One of the petitioners seeking production of the non-prosecution agreement; identified as a victim of Jeffrey Epstein by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jane Doe 2
persons.context: One of the petitioners seeking production of the non-prosecution agreement; identified as a victim of Jeffrey Epstein by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Jane Doe 1 is identified by the U.S. Attorney's Office as a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
Jane Doe 2 is identified by the U.S. Attorney's Office as a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
Judge Marra issued a court order concerning the disclosure of the non-prosecution agreement involving Epstein.

events.title: Court Orders Production of Epstein NPA
events.description: The U.S. District Court grants a motion to produce the non-prosecution agreement between the U.S. Attorney's Office and Jeffrey Epstein, subject to a protective order.

keyFacts: A federal court ordered the U.S. Attorney's Office to produce the non-prosecution agreement (NPA) it had with Jeffrey Epstein to the petitioners (Jane Does 1 and 2).
The order establishes a strict protective order, prohibiting the petitioners and any other identified victims from disclosing the NPA's terms to third parties without further court order.
The document confirms the existence of a formal non-prosecution agreement between federal prosecutors and Jeffrey Epstein.
The U.S. Attorney's Office had identified multiple individuals as victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
